data.name: AlternateDestinationMarkerLong
data.value: This option only works when the --{0} option is also specified. If there are alternate paths specified, this option indicates the name of a marker file that must be present in the folder. This can be used to handle situations where an external drive changes drive letter or mount point. By ensuring that a certain file exists, it is possible to prevent writing data to an unwanted external drive. The contents of the file are never examined, only file existence.

data.name: AlternateDestinationMarkerShort
data.value: Look for a file in the destination folder

data.name: AlternateTargetPathsLong
data.value: This option allows multiple targets to be specified. The primary target path is placed before the list of paths supplied with this option. Before starting the backup, each folder in the list is checked for existence and optionally the presence of the marker file supplied by --{0}. The first existing path that optionally contains the marker file is then used as the destination. Multiple destinations are separated with a {1},. On Windows, the path may be a UNC path, and the drive letter may be substituted with an asterisk (*), eg.: "*:\backup", which will examine all drive letters. If a username and password is supplied, the same credentials are used for all destinations.

data.name: AlternateTargetPathsShort
data.value: A list of secondary target paths

data.name: Description
data.value: This backend can read and write data to an file based backend. Allowed formats are "file://hostname/folder" or "file://username:password@hostname/folder". You may supply UNC paths (eg: "file://\\server\folder") or local paths (eg: (win) "file://c:\folder", (linux) "file:///usr/pub/files")

data.name: DescriptionFTPPasswordLong
data.value: The password used to connect to the server. This may also be supplied as the environment variable "FTP_PASSWORD".

data.name: DescriptionFTPPasswordShort
data.value: Supplies the password used to connect to the server

data.name: DescriptionFTPUsernameLong
data.value: The username used to connect to the server. This may also be supplied as the environment variable "FTP_USERNAME".

data.name: DescriptionFTPUsernameShort
data.value: Supplies the username used to connect to the server

data.name: NoDestinationWithMarkerFileError
data.value: The marker file "{0}" was not found in any of the examined destinations: {1}

data.name: UseMoveForPutLong
data.value: When storing the file, the standard operation is to copy the file and delete the original. This sequence ensures that the operation can be retried if something goes wrong. Activating this option may cause the retry operation to fail. This option has no effect unless the --disable-streaming-transfers options is activated.

data.name: UseMoveForPutShort
data.value: Move the file instead of copying it
